source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_008_chunk7

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_008_chunk7
evidence_span: The length of the incubation period depended on the amount of $K$ reduction, material strength, temperature, and the final $K$ in which cracking occurred

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_008_chunk7

evidence_span: Zirconium alloys have low solubility of hydrogen²

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_008_chunk7
evidence_span: zirconium hydride platelets are precipitated in the matrix when the hydrogen concentration exceeds the terminal solid solubility (TSS)

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_008_chunk7
evidence_span: The presence of hydrides can lead to a reduction in ductility and fracture toughness when the hydrides are oriented in the radial-axial plane of the pressure tube

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_008_chunk7
evidence_span: Zirconium alloys containing hydrogen above TSS are also susceptible to fracture by delayed hydride cracking (DHC)
